medium: Pen and brown ink over traces of black chalk
creditline: Bequest of Dan Fellows Platt, Class of 1895

makers.displaydate: 1527–1585; born Genoa, Italy; died Madrid, Spain
makers.displaymaker: Luca Cambiaso, 1527–1585; born Genoa, Italy; died Madrid, Spain

texts.textentryhtml:
Purchased in New York in 1920 by Dan Fellows Platt, stamp (L. 750a) verso, lower left on mount, in black.;

From Finch College, “Drawings of Luca Cambiaso”: dated 1547. (See reference Bib. 4512);

bibliography.boilertext: Suzanne Folds McCullagh and Laura M. Giles, Italian drawings before 1600 in the Art Institute of Chicago: a catalogue of the collection, (Chicago, IL: The Art Institute of Chicago, 1997).
bibliography.citation: Suzanne Folds McCullagh and Laura M. Giles, Italian drawings before 1600 in the Art Institute of Chicago: a catalogue of the collection, (Chicago, IL: The Art Institute of Chicago, 1997)., p. 62

bibliography.boilertext: Drawings of Luca Cambiaso, Moneglia, Italy, 1527-1585 El Escorial, Spain: a loan exhibition, Nov. 22, 1967-Jan. 21, 1968, Finch College Museum of Art, (New York: Finch College Museum of Art, 1967).
bibliography.citation: Drawings of Luca Cambiaso, Moneglia, Italy, 1527-1585 El Escorial, Spain: a loan exhibition, Nov. 22, 1967-Jan. 21, 1968, Finch College Museum of Art, (New York: Finch College Museum of Art, 1967)., no. 3

bibliography.boilertext: Lauro Magnani, Luca Cambiaso da Genova all’Escorial, (Genova: Sagep, 1995).
bibliography.citation: Lauro Magnani, Luca Cambiaso da Genova all’Escorial, (Genova: Sagep, 1995)., 120n

bibliography.boilertext: Heinz Widauer, Italienische Zeichnungen des 16. Jahrhunderts: die Graphische Sammlung des Linzer Stadtmuseums Nordico, (Linz: Das Stadtmuseum Linz, 1991).

bibliography.boilertext: Laura Giles, Lia Markey, Claire Van Cleave, et. al., Italian Master Drawings from the Princeton University Art Museum, (Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Art Museum, 2014).
bibliography.citation: Laura Giles, Lia Markey, Claire Van Cleave, et. al., Italian Master Drawings from the Princeton University Art Museum, (Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Art Museum, 2014)., p. 50, cat. no. 19; p. 51 (illus.)
